question_sentence: A SpaceX capsule carrying stranded Nasa astronauts back to Earth splashed down off the coast of which state?
evidence: Sunita 'Suni' Williams and Barry 'Butch' Wilmore's eight-day mission on the International Space Station turned into a nine-month stay due to problems with their Boeing Starliner spacecraft. They were brought home along with two other astronauts in a SpaceX capsule this week, and taken for medical check-ups as they begin readjusting to life on Earth.

question_sentence: New evidence suggests the "dark energy" expanding the universe is doing what?
evidence: Scientists working with the Dark Energy Spectroscopic Instrument (DESI) presented new evidence supporting the theory that dark energy does not maintain a constant rate of acceleration, but rather appears to be weakening. If borne out, that would suggest the universe may one day stop expanding, or even start contracting.

question_sentence: Which team won the English Football League's Carabao Cup with a 2-1 victory over Liverpool?
evidence: The Magpies' victory made Eddie Howe the first English manager to win a major trophy in 17 years. In doing so he revived a debate about the dearth of home-grown talent at the top of English football, which last flared up when German Thomas Tuchel was hired to manage the national men's team.

question_sentence: Oxford University's project to study animal dung to help preserve endangered species is called what?
evidence: Scientists involved in Oxford's "Poo Zoo" project are investigating whether animal dung can help preserve endangered species by capturing genetic diversity. The team extracts living cells from animal faeces to study populations and potentially breed animals without using live donors.

question_sentence: Which country's senate has launched an investigation into the arrest of its former president by the International Criminal Court?
evidence: Senator Imee Marcos, sister of president Ferdinand Marcos Jr, announced an "urgent" investigation into Rodrigo Duterte's arrest. Former president Duterte is being held in connection with alleged human rights abuses, including extrajudicial killings, carried out during his war on drugs while in office between 2016 and 2022.

question_sentence: Which US state was struck by 32 tornadoes?
evidence: A series of intense tornadoes, wildfires and dust storms devastated the Midwest and South, with Missouri suffering the most casualties with 13 deaths. Although the severe weather is expected to ease, meteorologists warn that more storms could occur in the coming weeks.

question_sentence: Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump are said to have discussed which sport during their phone call this week?
evidence: During the much-anticipated telephone summit between the leaders, Putin suggested a series of ice hockey matches between NHL players and the stars of the KHL, Russia's domestic league, according to a Kremlin summary of the call. The White House's own recap of the conversation did not include any mention of the sport.

question_sentence: A Peruvian fisherman was found alive after drifting at sea for how many days?
evidence: Máximo Napa Castro expected to spend a month at sea but was left stranded after his engine failed. He survived by eating cockroaches, birds and turtles before being discovered by an Ecuadorian ship hundreds of miles off the coast.

question_sentence: Who was elected as the next president of the International Olympic Committee?
evidence: Zimbabwe-born Coventry, who won three swimming medals at the 2004 Athens Olympics, was chosen to succeed Thomas Bach in the IOC's strict and secretive election. Coventry, currently Zimbabwe's Minister of Youth, Sport, Arts and Recreation, will formally take on the role at a ceremony in June.

question_sentence: What unusual model helped a Vinted seller go viral for showcasing her unwanted clothes?
evidence: Cara O'Brien, from Huntingdon, went viral on Vinted after she used a teddy bear to model her clothes. The brown stuffed bear has "posed in everything from crop tops to mini skirts and dresses" and has helped her earn at least £500 in sales.

question_sentence: Thousands of previously classified files were released this week. What were the documents about?
choices: The full House ethics report on former Rep. Matt Gaetz
The “deep state” agents working at the DOJ
The assassination of President John F. Kennedy
The blend of herbs and spices used in KFC fried chicken
evidence: The Trump administration released thousands of records related to the JFK assassination, many of which had been previously redacted.

question_sentence: Astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore returned to Earth this week after their planned short stay in space stretched into a more than nine-month mission. Where did their capsule touch down?
choices: In the middle of the Pacific Ocean
evidence: Williams and Wilmore, alongside NASA’s Nick Hague and cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov of Russia’s Roscosmos space agency, safely splashed down off the coast of Tallahassee, Florida at 5:57 p.m. ET on Tuesday.

question_sentence: Which is the happiest country on Earth for the eighth year in a row?
evidence: Finland took the top spot again. In contrast, the US came in at No. 24 in the 2025 World Happiness Report, its lowest ranking ever.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice rebuked President Trump for calling a federal judge “crooked” and saying he should be impeached?
evidence: Chief Justice John Roberts pushed back on the president’s escalating rhetoric against the federal judiciary, issuing a statement that said “… impeachment is not an appropriate response to disagreement concerning a judicial decision.”

question_sentence: Soccer phenom McKenna Whitham became the youngest player to appear in a National Women's Soccer League regular season match. How old is she?
evidence: NJ/NY Gotham’s Whitham, 14, is also the youngest player to sign in the National Women's Soccer League and the youngest athlete to sign a contract with Nike.

question_sentence: A person dressed in black set fire to several Tesla vehicles this week. Where did the incident take place?
evidence: Surveillance video showed the suspect shooting at the cars at a Las Vegas repair facility and igniting two of them with Molotov cocktails. The FBI is investigating the incident as a possible act of terrorism.

question_sentence: A thief was recently convicted of stealing this one-of-a-kind item from a British palace. What was it?
evidence: Michael Jones stole a fully functional 18-karat gold toilet from Blenheim Palace, the country mansion where former Prime Minister Winston Churchill was born.

question_sentence: Which company said its CEO was ousted without board approval for the brand's repeated public comments on progressive issues?
evidence: Ben & Jerry’s accused its parent company Unilever of breaching its merger agreement by “removing and replacing” CEO David Stever by not following the proper protocols and said it was because of the brand’s continued comments on progressive issues.

question_sentence: A powerful storm system tore across the US last weekend, killing at least 42 people across eight states and devastating communities. Arkansas experienced two EF4 tornados for the first time in over 25 years. What does EF stand for?
evidence: The strength of tornadoes is rated on the Enhanced Fujita, or EF, Scale, named after Tetsuya “Ted” Fujita, an engineer and meteorologist who developed the original version of it in 1971.

question_sentence: A Hollywood writer-director was arrested on charges that he swindled $11 million from Netflix for a sci-fi show that never aired. What is he accused of spending the money on?
evidence: Carl Erik Rinsch was charged with wire fraud and money laundering for allegedly spending $11 million provided by Netflix for an unfinished show called “White Horse” on cryptocurrency investments and a series of lavish purchases that included a fleet of Rolls-Royces and a Ferrari.
